homoglyph_attack_module.name: Homoglyph Attack
homoglyph_attack_module.description:
About this attack module:
Homoglyphs are alternative words for words comprising of ASCII characters.
Example of a homoglyph fool -> fooI
This module purturbs the prompt with all available homoglyphs for each word present.
Parameters:
1. MAX_ITERATIONS - Maximum number of prompts that should be sent to the target. [Default: 20]

toxic_sentence_generator.name: Toxic Sentence Generator
toxic_sentence_generator.description: This module generates toxic sentence based on a given seed prompt. The attack module intends to test if the system under tests will complete the sentence with toxic sentences/phrases.

insert_punctuation_attack_module.name: Insert Punctuation Attack
insert_punctuation_attack_module.description:
About this attack module:
This module creates perturbations through adding punctuation to the start of words in a prompt.
Parameters:
1. MAX_ITERATIONS - Number of prompts that should be sent to the target. [Default: 10]
2. word_swap_ratio - Percentage of words ina prompt that should be perturbed. [Default: 0.2]

textbugger_attack_module.name: TextBugger Attack
textbugger_attack_module.description:
About this attack module:
This module implements the perturbations listed in the paper TEXTBUGGER: Generating Adversarial Text Against Real-world Applications.
Parameters:
1. MAX_ITERATIONS - Number of prompts that should be sent to the target. This is also thenumber of transformations that should be generated. [Default: 5]
2. word_swap_ratio - Percentage of words in a prompt that should be perturbed. [Default: 0.2]
3. top_k - To select top k number of semantic words from the GLoVe embedding. [Default: 5]
4. threshold - semantic similarity threshold for the universal encoder. [Default: 0.8]
Note:
Usage of this attack module requires the internet. Initial downloading of the GLoVe embedding occurs when the UniversalEncoder is called.
Embedding is retrieved from the following URL: https://textattack.s3.amazonaws.com/word_embeddings/paragramcf

charswap_attack_module.name: Character Swap Attack
charswap_attack_module.description:
About this attack module:
This module creates perturbations through swapping characters for words that contains more than 3 characters.
Parameters:
1. MAX_ITERATIONS - Number of prompts that should be sent to the target. [Default: 10]
2. word_swap_ratio -Percentage of words in a prompt that should be perturbed. [Default: 0.2]

textfooler_attack_module.name: TextFooler Attack
textfooler_attack_module.description:
About this attack module:
This module implements the perturbations listed in the paper Is BERT Really Robust? A Strong Baseline for Natural Language Attack on Text Classification and Entailment.
Parameters:
1. MAX_ITERATIONS - Number of prompts that should be sent to the target. This is also the number of transformations that should be generated. [Default: 5]
2. word_swap_ratio - Percentage of words in a prompt that should be perturbed. [Default: 0.2]
3. cosine_sim - Minimum word embedding cosine similarity [Default: 0.5]
4. window_size - Window size for the Universal Sentence Encoder (USE). [Default: 15]
5. threshold - Semantic similarity threshold for the USE. [Default: 0.840845057]
6. max_candidates - Number of nearest candidates to swap words with. [Default: 50]
Note:
Usage of this attack module requires the internet. Initial downloading of the GLoVe embedding occurs when the UniversalEncoder is called.
Embedding is retrieved from the following URL: https://textattack.s3.amazonaws.com/word_embeddings/paragramcf

sample_attack_module.name: Sample Attack Module
sample_attack_module.description: This is a sample attack module.

colloquial_wordswap_attack_module.name: Colloquial Wordswap
colloquial_wordswap_attack_module.description:
About this attack module:
This attack module takes in prompts that feature nouns that describe people.
Examples of this include words like 'girl' , 'boy' or 'grandmother'.
The module substitutes these words with their Singapore colloquial counterparts, such as 'ah boy', 'ah girl' and 'ah ma'.
Parameters (Non-exhaustive):
grandmother - ah ma
grandfather - ah gong
girl - ah ger
boy - ah boy
father - papa
mother - mama
aunty - makcik
man - ah beng
woman - ah lian

job_role_generator.name: Job Role Generator Module
job_role_generator.description: This attack module adds demographic groups to the job role.

violent_durian.name: Violent Durian
violent_durian.description: This is a multi-turn agent designed to interact over several exchanges. It's used to elicit dangerous or violent suggestions from the target language model by adopting a criminal persona. The application is experimental

malicious_question_generator.name: Malicious Question Generator
malicious_question_generator.description: This attack module generates malicious questions using OpenAI's GPT4 based on a given topic. This module will stop by the number of iterations (Default: 50). To use this attack module, you need to configure an 'openai-gpt4'endpoint.
